column98: Innovative Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) Expert to guide sustainability thinking
column99:
Innovative Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) Expert to guide sustainability thinking 
 Job-Link is looking for an expert to identify hotspots and explore possible improvements using LCA.  Are you driven by purpose and would you like to help make complex pharma facilities more sustainable?  
 
 About the role 
 Job-Link are looking for an innovative LCA expert to join our client´s multi-disciplinary team of nine sustainability professionals. Our client works on reducing the pharmaceutical industry’s environmental impact. In this role, your focus will be  on production, resources and supply . 
The team executes consulting, construction and optimization projects. 
 Our Client use LCA for decision support, facilitate ideation, make simulations, develop new approaches and concepts to help our customers make more sustainable choices. Our client needs you to conduct life cycle assessments and take a leading role in developing our LCA methods. 
 
 As an LCA expert , you will be working with a knowledgeable, multi-disciplinary team where you will be: 
 
 Conducting life cycle assessments in both large and small-scale projects 
 Identifying environmental hotspots and assessing different technologies, materials and processes 
 Making calculations on resource consumption, cost benefit analysis and other investigations 
 Taking a leading role in developing LCA methods from our current focus on climate into biodiversity 
 Planning and facilitating workshops, meetings, and presentation with project stakeholders 
 
 
 As a person, you are: 
 
 Inspired by the process of making explorative LCA quantifications, guided by professional curiosity 
 Passionate about innovative technologies that can help the progress of sustainable development 
 Able to focus on the overall purpose, while operating in a detailed and complex environment 
 Eager to develop your knowledge of pharmaceutical facilities and processes 
 
 
 These qualifications are needed for you to be a success in this role: 
 
 Degree in engineering (e.g. environmental or mechanical, chemical, sustainable, industrial engineering) 
 Experienced consultant and enjoy facilitating processes 
 Experience working with both attributional and consequential LCA methodologies 
 Speak and write English fluently 
 
 
 You are also welcome to highlight alternative experience that you believe would be valuable in this role. 
 We invite you to apply and join our client’s highly professional team. 
This is a consultant position ranging from 2 to 4 years. 
 
 Deadline of application is February 18, 2024.  
 We will review applications and invite candidates for interviews on a rolling basis. 
 Please note that we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.    
 We are looking forward to receiving your CV and short cover letter.
